intro: Drymonia crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved drymonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Drymonia crassa thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
